main_definition: The quality of being consistent or the state of having uniformity in structure, composition, behavior, etc.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Uniformity in elements that make up something
meanings_and_examples.example: The consistency of ingredients in a recipe ensures it tastes the same every time.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Adherence to principles or standards over time
meanings_and_examples.example: Consistency in ethical behavior means always acting according to one's values, even when no one is watching.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The quality of being reliable and dependable
meanings_and_examples.example: A consistent work schedule allows employees to plan their lives with less stress.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Coherence in ideas or actions, particularly related to fairness or justice
meanings_and_examples.example: Judicial consistency is crucial for maintaining public trust in the legal system.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The state of not changing over time; stability
meanings_and_examples.example: The consistency of a well-crafted machine means fewer breakdowns and maintenance issues.
